Waste statistics and disposal costs

All figures are tonnes unless otherwise specified

Recycling end use register

Our end use register for all our waste recycled from residents is available for download  Recycling end use register 2012-13 (for previous years see right hand side of page).  This shows you where all the material goes for recycling.

Record of waste recycled, reused, recovered or composted

Record of waste sent to landfill

Collected household waste landfilled

 2007/08 2008/09 2009/10 2010/11 2011/12
Domestic waste collected from households 34,610 35,745 34,451 30,514 18,130
Other domestic waste 2,590 2,952 2,902 3,144 3,224
Waste from Recycling Centres 8,055 7,307 7,431 6,789 6,456
*Total tonnes of municipal waste landfilled (this includes household and commercial waste) 55,507 52,743 50,660 45,603 33,767

*Note: This figure includes waste landfilled indirectly by the Council e.g. Clinical waste, which is sent for treatment.  The operator of this plant will then dispose of the waste, and the fee for processing is set accordingly

Summary of what happens to household waste

*Household Waste Summary 2007/08 **2008/09 2009/10 2010/11 2011/12
Total Household Waste Collected 79,430 80,041 77,779 74,728 74,718
Total Household Waste Recycled 21,464 20,550 20,752 21,679 22,383
Total Household Waste Composted  12,647 13,540 12,221 12,611 16,479
Total Household Waste Landfilled 44,942 46,150 44,579 40,422 30,656
           
Percentage of domestic waste sent for recycling or composting 42.94% 42.59% 42.39% 45.89% 52.01%

*Note 1: The above household waste summary is based on the definitions used for Government indicators, and therefore exclude rubble.  See links on right hand side for further information on these definitions.

**Note 2: The rise in the tonnes of household waste collected in 2008/09 is due to the reclassification of some waste streams from commercial waste to domestic waste following the clarification of guidance issued by DEFRA.  This includes waste collected from charities and nursing homes, which is commonly refered to as 'Schedule 2' waste (further information can be found within Schedule 2 of the Controlled Waste Regulations 1992.)

Reported national waste and recycling indicators

National Indicators 2007/08 2008/09 2009/10 2010/11 2011/12 
191 - Residual household waste per household (in kilogrammes) 601.86 608.74 588.99 529.68 467.62
192 - Percentage of household waste sent for reuse, recycling & composting 43% 43% 42% 46% 52%

193 - Percentage of municipal waste landfilled *

 57% 57% 56% 53% 40%

* Note: this includes all household and commercial waste sent to landfill

Waste collection and disposal costs

Costs

 2007/08 2008/09 2009/10 2010/11 2011/12
Landfill tax (charged per tonne) 24.00 32.00 40.00 48.00 56.00
Actual cost of landfill tax *1 1,327,552 1,684,859 2,014,466 2,181,932 1,776,376
Average cost per tonne of waste sent to landfill (actual gate fee costs only, excludes tax, transport and other associated costs)  20.72 24.58 23.43 20.70 14.04
Actual direct cost of landfilling our waste *2 1,145,087 1,294,033 1,180,032 941,528 445,435
Cost of collection per household (BVPI 86) 58.22 56.46 37.66 31.94  
Quartile position against other local authorities Bottom 25% No longer available No longer available No longer available No longer available 
Cost of Waste disposal per tonne (BVPI 87) - this includes all costs incurred by the Council 51.23 60.23 54.74 97.33 *3  
Quartile position against other local authorities Middle 50% No longer available No longer available No longer available No longer available 

* 1 & 2 Note: these costs only cover the landfill tax and disposal charges for the waste the Council has directly taken to landfill under its disposal contracts.

* 3 Note: Large variation is due to a re-valuation of assets/impairment change due to new International Accounting Standards.

Tonnes of Fly tipped wastes collected 284 159 153 101 70
Number of reported fly tips 468 351 522 478 282
Home Composting (Number of bins sold) 1,647 707 414 312 282
Number of abandoned vehicles scrapped 166 60 50 11  
Percentage of missed refuse bins (black bag waste) collected within 24hrs 93.39% 93.17% 83.51% Data no longer available Data no longer available
Percentage of refuse (black bag waste) collected 99.92% 99.92% 99.87% 99.94% 99.96%

New initiatives and service changes

Initiatives 2007/08 2008/09 2009/10 2010/11 2011/12 
           
Recycling performance 43.16% 42.60% 41.30% 46.00% 52.15%
Tonnes waste collected for disposal 44,942 46,150 45,149 40,442 30,000
           
Growth in total household waste -3.2% 0.8% -3.2% -3.9% 0.1%
Growth in household waste to landfill -7.7% 2.7% -2.2% -9.3% -25.8%
           
Changes to refuse collection services     Same day waste collection, June Food waste collections introduced Oct  
Kerbside box recycling     Cardboard added from kerbside organics in Dec.

Same day waste collection, June

 Food waste collections introduced Oct
Cardboard Recycling to MRCs phase in from Oct onwards		  
Kerbside organics collection     Cardboard removed and added to kerbside dry recyclables in Dec.

Same day waste collection, June

    
Other collection initiatives/changes   Reclassification of Schedule 2 waste      New waste treatment contract starts, diverting 9,100 tonnes of black bag waste from landfill
Major Recycling Centre developments WEEE recycling introduced   Plasterboard recycling introduced    
Bring site changes       removal of 5 low use bring banks (aug)  
Major Waste Campaigns activity
(over and above annual leaflets and advertising)		   WRAP behavioural change

Love food Hate waste 

 2 full time Recycling advisors employed, Nov Food waste promotion

 Food waste promotion

Give and take reuse days
